description:
Company Summary

DISH, an EchoStar Company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming smart home installation services, mobile plans and products, and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Infinite, Boost Mobile, DISH Wireless, OnTech and GenMobile.

Department Summary

Surpassing network limitations of the past, our Wireless Deployment organization is building the country’s first cloud-native, standalone 5G wireless network. This is the foundation of a connected world flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and transformative needs of today and the future.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

DISH Wireless seeks a skilled Data Scientist to join the Network Data and Analytics (ND&A) team within Network Development. As part of the broader Wireless Data Analytics and Science team, ND&A enhances Network Quality by interpreting end-to-end data from Network, Finance, and other sources to inform strategic decisions. Our team optimizes resources across network build, operation, management, and enhancement to deliver the best wireless experience for Subscribers and Enterprises.

In this role, you will:
• Utilize NLP for optimization opportunities, sentiment analysis, and contact outcome impacts.
• Develop new techniques for explaining network anomalies and optimization in 5G SA Open RAN.
• Design experiments and collaborate with stakeholders to optimize network resources.
• Develop machine learning capabilities for image processing and data modeling.
• Analyze data from various sources, including financials, to find correlations.
• Deliver data-driven insights and recommendations using statistical techniques and experimentation.
• Participate in the design and architecture of ML solutions, experiments, and causal inference.
• Communicate effectively with stakeholders, present findings, and share knowledge within the department.

Skills, Experience and Requirements

As a successful Principal Data Scientist, you will have:
• Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or Engineering, with 10+ years of experience.
• Proficiency in EDA, Modeling, and Machine Learning in R and/or Python.
• Expertise in ML Ops and model deployment pipelines using various tools.
• Strong skills in ETL tools and working with large datasets for product and process improvements.
• Advanced knowledge in developing complex operations research mathematical models for optimal business decisions.
• Experience with developing and deploying advanced meta-heuristic algorithms.
• Proficiency in modeling and deploying NLP techniques, including topic modeling and sentiment analysis.
• Extensive experience deploying LLMs and using common ML and Deep Learning frameworks like Tensorflow and PyTorch.

#LI-NH2

Salary Ranges

Compensation: $127,050.00/Year - $208,725.00/Year
Benefits

We also offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities, and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits.

The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location. Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test and DMV check.

This will be posted for a minimum of 3 days or until the position is filled.
